channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.description:
Report E-2023110114

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: About 10 gallon of product spilled from a 55-gallon metal drum onto the concrete dock due to a forklift puncture. a contractor was called to assist with spill cleanup of material. No storm drain, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2023110321
item.description:
Report E-2023110321

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 6, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbent, the damaged pails, and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101231
item.description:
Report X-2023101231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-22
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Responded to report of Nitric acid leak from tank car GATX220384 in Brosnan Yard Macon GA. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was coming from the liquid line valve. The liquid line valve was in closed position but product was leaking past the valve and the secondary closure cam lock cap. The cam Lock cap was missing a gasket. A gasket was installed for the cap and 4psi of pressure was scrubbed off of the tank car. The leak was stopped. The car will be held pending transfer of load.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box found on dock. Upon inspection the bottles inside were very loose and most of the bottles inside were close to empty. The bottles body was also dented due to impact with other package. Spill was cleaned with PPE and placed in salvage drum DescribePack: The bottles inside were very loose and most of the bottles inside were close to empty. The bottles body was also dented due to impact with other package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned with PPE and placed in salvage drum
